review: Little basal cell cancer removed. I always have some back, foot, hip pain but now everything is so painful at same time, horrible diarrhea, feel fatigued, almost like flu. I'm 68 with joint issues. It's bad to stop but I can't do it. Worried about c-diff. I took it before no problem but I can't function this time. Probably age and other conditions

I had a 500 mg dose/every 6 hours. I got something called a brain zap! It was terrifying. Days 4-10 every time I tried to fall asleep it felt like an electric current ran through my head a startled me awake. I’ve never felt that in my life. It got so bad I stayed up for 2 days straight. I woke up panicking every time. It was terrible. I usually have anxiety once or twice a week but this medication amplified my anxiety x10. I got at least 3 anxiety attacks a days like 30 min or more at a time. Other than that I had trouble breathing and slight body aches but the worst of it was the brain zaps and anxiety. My infection was completely gone in 2 days and clean almost pain free. Effective in that way absolutely BUT was not worth the side effects at all. If you have an option to take a different antibiotic I would recommend you do that!

I was given this for an infected hangnail on my finger. 500mg 2x a day for 7 days. Within hours after the first dose, I saw improvement. My finger was less red, less swollen, and less painful. Side effects tummy upset (bloating, gassiness), softer stools, and I felt a little jittery, like you've just drank 3 cups of coffee, only I don't drink caffeine. But I have a very sensitive tummy (IBS) and they only lasted for a couple hours after each dose and were mild.

I was prescribed Keflex (500mg) every 6 hours (4x) a day, for (7) days. I have only taken antibiotics once in my life when I was in high school. I am 28 now just to give you some perspective. I had a cosmetic procedure and my surgeon prescribed Keflex. The first day I was still coming off anesthesia so I didn’t feel much.But, the next day I felt horrible. I was so delirious, dizzy, confused. That was just the start! As the days went on I experienced blurred vision, sadness, extreme fatigue and then insomnia. One night I slept for only one hour. I have suffered some acute memory issues and brain fog.I have to say that this experience has left me very afraid of antibiotics and I only kept taking it because I had to in order to avoid possible infection. I will never willing take Keflex or any other antibiotic. But, I did not get an infection so I guess it did its job.

So I took Cephalexin to get rid of an infected cyst. It did the job for the most part, but it may have been less effective since I had already taken it before. I’m didn't have the side effects other people had: I didn’t have ANY nausea, stomach pain, drowsiness, anything with this medicine and I usually took it without food too. It didn’t really help the second time (after I got my cyst removed and stitches in) but that’s my fault, I was prescribed doxycycline and I took cephalexin AGAIN instead. Overall a good experience!
Keflex (cephalexin):Very bad reaction to this medication.  Multiple bouts of diarrhoea and stomach cramps.

I take this at a dose of 500mg every 6 hours for 7 days for an abscess on my scalp which had been very painful.  I noticed it start working  within 12 hours of first dose because the Pain began subsiding.  I seem to handle this antibiotic very well.  I’m so thankful for it.  The abscess was so painful it was making it even hard to sleep

No side effects except a little sleepiness, and a yeast infection a week after (this can be helped if you take acidophilus during treatment, but I forgot). Cephalexin cured my infection. God bless antibiotics!

Real frozen shoulder, which comes out of nowhere and lasts six months, was followed by frozen leg muscles and then frozen hips. When my chest throat and lung muscles became hugely painful I realised the infection was back. I ordered supplies for a long period of being housebound again.I was prescribed cefalexin/keto, actually for a UTI, so I had some. 500 three times a day.The pain stopped in two days. My system feels light, as though the whole latent infection had been cleaned out. A side effect was that the corn on the sole of my foot has disappeared after decades! I might have had a slight headache, that was all. In my case this medicine has been a miracle!  I am 79 and in the UK.  I was prescribed it on the NHS.

I was prescribed this drug 500 mg for 7 days after rhinoplasty to prevent infection. If taken without food I get nauseous and vomit, also leaves a metallic taste in your mouth all day. I was also prescribed opioids and that didn’t even cure the headaches from this drug, I am a emotional mess, crying all the time for no reason, insomnia and super fatigued, vivid nightmares also day 4 I got a horrible yeast infection. This is my last day and I truly hope that I go back to normal the depression and anxiety is the worse. Since it was not taken for a condition but for preventative purposes after surgery not sure if it worked but the side effects are horrendous! Hope I never have to take this ever again!

Prescribed in the ER after a superficial burn infected (4cm).  My dose is 500mg x 4 times a day for 5 days and I am on the second day.I called to hospital to ask severe side effects.Been on antibiotics many times but with this drug the side effects are a lot heavier:- Extreme tiredness and weakness that I can’t even open my eyes - sleeping 10-12 hours (getting pill each 6 hour) waking up  with severe fatigue and body aches - my anxiety is off to roof- I have ongoing heaviness feeling and breathing spasms on my chest- my stomach is so weird (not burn, not pain) like someone punching me and I have a pressure on my belly, feeling like I had a big meal but I haven’t had anything other than 1-2 small meals in 3 days. -  mild sore throat and minor cough - and my infection is not healing fastAt this stage I am fighting with antibiotics more than the infection !+ I am on probiotics and having yogurt I hope this helps, other comments helped me to understand  what’s going on w my body.

I developed an infection in my fingernail after scrubbing a floor; overnight it involved my whole finger with infection.  My doctor gave me Cephalexin 500mg 4x a day.  The first day was not too bad although I was beginning to develop a headache, drowsiness, and lost my desire to eat.  By day 4 my stomach was swollen and cramping, I had terrible nausea, a constant headache and my eyes felt irritated and burning.  At that point I had 7 more days to go on the medicine and could not face it.  I called the doctor and asked to be switched to another antibiotic.  I could not go to work or even get out of bed at that point.

I had a Cosmetic procedure- fat removal which caused an infection, so was prescribed this. Had to stop this antibiotic in the middle of the week because it wasn’t tolerable.***days later developed floaters in eye that are not going away***after emergency eye dr appointment, he has referred me to a retinal specialist.

Keflex (cephalexin):I had a tooth that broke off while eating pretzels well as time goes by no real problems with it, however it made the tooth next to it get loose & agitated it becomes an infection I get put on Keflex 500 mg three times a day for seven days for the infection I have taken this medication before after two days the infection starts to go away my mouth feels better. I’m not in pain anymore however, the night terrors, hallucinations, & anxiety. The night terrors are morbid they are something out of the  Saw  movies! If you have any mental disorders or any small underline ones  I recommend you do not take this medication Bc it WILL MAKE YOU CRAZY!

Keflex (cephalexin):I have a slight eye tissue infection. Optometrist suggested Keflex 2 a day 10 days. Let it be known I have experience taking a large amount of pharma’s over my lifetime. 3 hours into the first pill my back completely seized up and tightened. All my lumbar muscles to a came to an aching halt. Something I have never felt before in my life. I have competed in highly competitive sports my whole life and know my body well from years of training, and never in my life have felt weird muscle discomfort as I did taking this. Almost 24 hours after taking 1 pill I still feel the pain. It all depends on the person after reading other people not feeling any sort of discomfort from taking this stuff. I will not be taking this again.

I read these reviews before I started taking Cephalexin and was scared of all the side effects. After 7 days of taking it, I have experienced no side effects but I have made an effort to take the pills with food. On the downside, the antibiotic has had no effect on my folliculitis so far.

Keflex (cephalexin):I was taking Bactrim for 2 days with no improvement before being prescribed Keflex QID for 7 days to take with Bactrim for an infected cut on my wrist from punching glass.As soon as I began Keflex, I started noticing improvement. It's hard to say whether the improvement or my side effects were from Keflex or Bactrim, so take this with a grain of salt. I had tachycardia, chills, nausea, indigestion, gas pain that felt like chest pain, itching on arms/legs, petechiae on my upper arms, frequent urination, and eventual yeast infection for which I had to take diflucan. I had some symptoms together, and some separate. Most of my side effects came at night though, so it could've been some kind of reaction between the two?The side effects definitely hit me harder in the beginning, but by my 5th day of Keflex, almost all side effects had subsided. I suggest taking with probiotics that can survive stomach acid and easily digestible food and drink a lot of water.

Look, as far as my skin goes, the keflex is great- no new rashes or lumps, healed swiftly, I feel human again. But three days in I start having the worst most dark dreams! And these dreams don't stop! So 10/10 if you want vivid dreams, just make sure you can handle yourself because they are not Good Dreams ok?

I had been taking valtrex for a herpes rash on my hands that became infected, and was taking bactrim for that. The valtrex was causing severe panic attacks, the doc prescribed cephalexin because he believed the meds were interacting. 250 mg 4 times a day for 14 days. I stopped taking the valtrex and the severe panic stopped but still need the antibibotics for 10 more days. I've had no appetite, diarrhea, abdominal cramping, shaking, chills and sweating but no fever with still borderline panic attacks because my anxiety is so high. The side effects are what I can consider tolerable most of the time although I've nearly gone to the emergency room twice. I currently have 4 more doses and will be done in 24 hours and I am ready for it to be over. The medication did do its job well but I wish I had stayed on the bactrim

Had cosmetic surgery six weeks ago, including me a decent amount of liposuction. I’ve had cosmetic surgery before, but never a huge amount of swelling that occurred right after surgery. The swelling was so bad my sutures were becoming dislodged and infected. Doctors could not figure out what was causing the swelling, so an urgent care physician Prescribed Keflex. Within the first day, the swelling was noticeably down. I was thrilled beyond belief! I had no side effects, was prescribed 500 mg three times a day. Very happy.

Took cephalexin 4 times a day, 500 mgs a dose, for about two weeks for a dermal cyst. It effect was not immediate, but by the third I started to see real improvement. Within ten days it had almost completely vanished. BUT OH  DID I FEEL TERRIBLE...I had heard that "drowsiness" was a "rare" side effect of this drug, at least according to the drug company, who during their trials must have enrolled some other species that just looked human to study, because almost EVERYONE who takes this feels like a truck almost ran over them..  they have experienced real sedation, dizziness, brain fog, irritability, a blocking of the effects of antidepressants, weakness etcI had most of these, and for several days AFTER taking it, I still felt out of sorts....I will never take this drug again as I feel like I lost two weeks of my life because of a minor problem that could have been treated with something just as effective but not as horrible.

Was prescribed this medication cephalexin for a minor UTI over a year ago and again more recently for a peridontal infection.Bleeding gums have cleared up in two days, but now I'm not sure I'm not peeing blood. Was prescribed 500 mg 4x a day for 7 days, but now I'm paranoid that it's causing another problem or that I may have overdosed. Because it's a sulfur medication, it tastes and smells like rotten eggs and is very hard to even get down. I much prefer bactrim, don't ever want to take this again.

I've been prescribed cephalexin way too much, I'm on it for the 4th time for pretty bad staph infection that I've had for over a year now, day 4 of 500mg 3x a day and I'm exhausted, having panic attacks, dizziness, confusion and headache but the infection is still there, i am only giving this a 4 rating because there's really been no change except cysts are worse and side. Effects are intolerablen I'm sure its because I've been prescribed antibiotics so much that they just don't work anymore.

Surprised this old antibiotic drug cephalexin still works. I've had good luck with it for my recurrent cellulitis. I had to get a repeat course for my first infection, but that was probably because it was a really bad one (my ankle was the size of an abnormally large grapefruit).Taking it three times a day is a bit of a hassle and the odor of the medication is foul enough to peel wallpaper, but I would rather deal with these trivial inconveniences than end up on IV antibiotics. I'm able to take this medication with or without food, but taking it without food gave me a stomachache. The good news is that it doesn't take a lot of food to blunt its side effects - a PB&J sandwich or a protein bar is enough.

I was on cephlexin for a cyst a dose of 500mg, taking it 2 times a day, morning and night. For 7 days. I haven't had any problems. I haven't drank coffee or alcohol. I drink tons of water, and gatorade. It helps.

My son had a small skin infection on his cheek near his eye, so he was on this medicine and he thought he was losing his mind. The side effects are damaging for this drug. Now it is still in his system as he struggles to not go crazy. This is a horrible drug.

I had a cyst removed and was given cephalexin to stop it getting infected. Took the first one at 2:30 pm finished the work day eat dinner @ 7: 30.  Then started getting side effects, the  chest pain started by 12:00  i could barely breathe and the  chest pain is so severe now  pain in the shoulders and neck hurt to breathe  can not lay down else the pain gets 2 times as bad. At hospital now chest xray, CT scan blood tests  ultra sound . Nitro glisoran   helped a little  all test came back negative  for heart , blockages,  next day a little better got to dr. Said I had a reaction  to this antibiotic  I will never take this  again close to death after taking one pill.

I am writing this review because Cephalexin has saved my life a number of times and while that does not mean it will necessarily do the same for you, please know that despite all the negative stories you will read here to which you must pay attention as well, I am still here on this earth as a result of having taken it and continue to take it when necessary. Thank God it DOES work for some.

I was given this antibioitic cephalexin  for a stab wound accidentally self inflicted. I feel horrible. I have low to no energy. I'm sitting in the bathroom with diarrhea and nausea. This is my first day on it. I do  think I can tolerate it.

Took as directed by doctor for two weeks to treat Folliculitis. Within a couple days of completing the Folliculitis is back worse than ever. All it did was endless diarrhea for two weeks straight. This medication was useless.
I had the antibiotic cephalexin and I'm getting more boils...thought it was suppose to clear them up

Horrible medicine. My doctor prescribed me cephalexin for an infected boil that  I burst & got infected. I was told to take 4 tabs 500 mg daily for 7 days I'm a lupus patient already taking plaquenil 400 mg daily. Anyways I went after 7 days the infection wasn't healed yet so my doctor told me to continue for 10 more day but when I started to continue I got a horrible rash all over my arms & neck, along with this I got continuous headaches so I stopped the medication. But the rash is still there & I'm getting blisters on my body. Thinking to go in an emergency.

Keflex (cephalexin):I was prescribed Keflex and within 5 hours of taking the first dose I developed and intense case of hives covering my upper chest and arms from elbow to elbow. The pain was intense. They took me off the Keflex and I got better, however, I still have issues with hives from even small scratches.
Have bursitis on left elbow didn't know if was infected or not so they have me keflex twice a day only side effect I had was it tore my belly up

Cephalexin got rid of infection but I had horrible side effects. I took it for 4 days, at a dose of 500mg, 4 times a day. I hadhorrible headaches, diarrhea, major depression, eyes dry and blood shot, nausea, very tired, didn't have motivation to do anything. Anxiety, joints were on fire! Stopped a day ago and still feel awful! Won't take again because of side effects.
I obtained cephalexin when I contracted folliculitis. In my moment of need, the drug actually had a negative effect on my condition.

Keflex (cephalexin):Been on Keflex for a week now for folliculitis, 2 pills (500 mgs each) for a week (Finished the whole bottle) and my Folliculitis is still the same. No really side effects for me. I’ve had Folliculitis for a month now and nothing seems to help.

I have this lump on my left side of my neck just above my collar bone (infected lymph node) and they gave me Keflex to take 4 times a day and it is supposed to help the swelling go down, but it has a little but not a lot I am my 4th day in and I have had nightmares for 2 of those days and no other side affects.

I just started this medication for a cyst on my chest. I'm also HIV positive (not AIDS). My stomach feel so tight and knotted. I'm not able to eat, my throat feels like I'm getting strep or something. I'm going to give it until the 3rd day before I call my doctor and ask for another antibiotic. I'm taking 500mg 3x a day for 30 days.

I was given  cephalexin for my tooth infection, 250mg four daily for 7 days. I have one more day left. Thank goodness. I've been extremely tired and have had nausea since taking this med. I haven't been able to eat much other than oatmeal, jello and crackers. I hope it has done the job as I don't think I can stomach it much longer. I'm allergic to sulpha drugs so it was either this or penicillin which both has similar side effects.

Was prescribed this for  blistering and weeping legs that were swollen and that had a skin tear where blisters were previously.  I was on this for preventive measures, no infection at the time, also had this medication a year or so before after having a cyst on my back and again after surgery, no problems with the medication.  Although this drug smells like sulfa and the taste is horrible as with a lot of drugs, even though these are capsules, these were combined with Bactrim antibiotic
Infected razor bumps the medicine works perfect and I only paid $8.00 with a coupon.
While this med was quite effective, I found the taste to be nauseating and the smell was quite nasty.

I had a staph infection in my nose so my doctor put me on a week of cephalexin, 500mg 3x daily. I was worried about GI side effects but was absolutely fine. The only side effects I noticed were very very minimal fatigue and the slightest headache that was barely noticeable. I also took a once daily probiotic with my dose in the evening just for peace of mind.

My husband developed infection at the surgical incision site following Radical Nephrectomy after diagnosis of Transitional Cell Carcinoma. Everything seemed fine til post op 11 days when staples removed & nurse commented wound still draining & put a bandage on after which is unusual. 2 days later, started having more pain, felt worse, less energy. 4 days after staples were removed said incision felt hot. Was red where it had been draining & hot to touch. Entire incision line hard & rigid which doctor shrugged off as hematoma we spent 4 hours in ER. No blood work. Given Keflex 4 times a day for 7 days. Had been taking it now for 3 1/2 days. Redness & hot area has spread, still no energy, no appetite & does not feel well. Going back to ER because should have been given a stronger antibiotic, especially after having surgery with chance of MRSA (Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus) which can’t be treated with first line antibiotics. Would not recommend this to anyone!!!

I was prescribed Cephalexin by a doctor at a hospital I visited when my arm swelled up and the rash I had got very severe.  I had been exposed to Poison Sumac three weeks prior and it just went nuts in that third week.  When the swelling entered my hand, I knew I was in trouble.  I was prescribed Prednisone which got rid of the swelling splendidly and Cephalexin to deal with the infection.  The Cephalexin dosage was 4 per day for 7 days.  It made me overly anxious, I had trouble sleeping, my stomach was little upset, and I ended up with vaginal discharge (really yucky), but it was so important to get rid of that infection, I took the entire prescription.  My arm is in much better shape though not 100% yet.   I am satisfied with the positive results.

Excellent medication for soft tissue infection.  Prescribed 500 mg 4x daily for 7 days - noticeable improvement after 24 hours, significant improvement after 48 hours.  I'm thrilled.  On day one I did feel some stomach upset which easily subsided with a bit of food and rest.

I was prescribed Cephalexin 500 mg 3X day for 10 days. From first day I had stomach pain, diarrhea, headache, anxiety, confusion and heart palpitations.  At first I thought all of these issues were from being sick and lack of sleep. By day two I knew it was this medicine. I went down to two doses a day but by day 5 I had to stop taking it. Worst drug ever! The smell of the drug is a cross between a rotting dead animal and rotten eggs, never again will I touch this drug. Usually I read drug info before starting a drug but I was so sick I failed to do this first. Going forward I will not make this mistake. I experienced too many side effects from this drug.

I have chronic folliculitis that has left scars on my lower legs. Twice I was prescribed topical ointments by a dermatologist that did nothing. My primary doctor prescribed Keflex and the results were amazing. Now  every time I have  flare up from shaving during the summer months, I request Keflex. I do not experience any side effects. I try not to shave as often, use good and clean razors, but the Keflec has been what helps me the most.
Started feeling better almost instantly. It does give me serious tunnel vision and I am not be able to focus as much on my surroundings. Hopefully keeps doing a great job!

I was on 500mg four times a day for the week. It was great the first few days until I woke up because my stomach started burning. I had consistent diarrhea the whole day and the next. I also started feeling anxious to the point of a possible panic attack which I haven’t gotten in about 3 years. Needless to say yes it helped my infection however I would rather have it then go through that again. I had to leave work half way through my shift because of it so I tossed them in the garbage.

I GOT  really bad cellulitis from sinus infection and it was spreading to my eye. Went in to see my Doctor and she gave me two choices, be on oral and it take longer or go to the ER and get an IV infusion that would stop it sooner. I went to the  ER and they kept me THREE Days.I am a Nurse and have been around the medical science and they were rotating my antibiotic to cover AND heal. IF It is not getting better on oral.......call back don't mess around with a staph or strep infection.  I FEEL BETTER THE CHOICE I MADE AND THIS WAS A MEDICATION THEY USED AMONG OTHERS.

Ended up with an infected wound after foot surgery. Was leaking pus and blood from the incision site. Was put on 500mg 2x a day for 10 days. After the 3rd day I noticed no more pus, just blood draining. The pain decreased as well. No bad reaction as I usually get very nauseous from other antibiotics but not Keflex. I made sure to take the dose on time every day and had a small meal 10 minutes before each dose. 2 hours after each dose I took a double dose of probiotics and was also taking saccharomyces boulardii (another probiotic but it is a yeast and is not killed by antibiotic since it is not a bacteria). Did NOT experience any stomach pains, diarrhea, anxiety,l ight headiness like others. Also stopped drinking coffee and consuming sugar while on these antibiotics, bacteria thrives on sugar in the gut and the coffee makes your body acidic.

Prescribed cephalexin for a fingernail infection because I asked for an "easy on the stomach" antibiotic.  4 times a day for 7 days, what a nuisance.  First few doses I took definitely made me nauseous, but now I am taking it with food and lots of water and I notice less nausea.  I also feel my anxiety is worsened a bit and I keep getting hot flashes...not normal for me!  Wonder if it's another side effect.  But nonetheless, my infection started healing within 24 hours and it's doing it's job.

I went on Cephalexin for the beginning of a staph infection caused by an ingrown hair on my bikini line- I'm currently on day 5 of my 7 day treatment and my infection is fully healed. Pleasant experience overall- no side effects besides headaches the first 2 days but minor; pain relievers not needed. However, I didn't consume alcohol or caffeine for the entirety of the treatment as I was advised that Cephalexin enhances side effects caused by alcohol and coffee such as drowsiness, dizziness, upset stomach, ect. I had a Chai drink containing a very little amount of caffeine- I got dizzy and very anxious within the hour of drinking it; never happened to me before despite countless times having the drink so I related it to the drug, further exemplifying how much the medication enhances both physiological and neurological effects of substances such as caffeine. I recommend this medication, but use with caution- no caffeine or alcohol.

Hello, I wanted to share my experience with Keflex AKA cephalexin. My son had some sort of skin boil according to my doctor  anyway I thought it was some sort of infection that may have been contagious. Anyway it cleared up now I'm getting a boil looking thing it's warm to the touch on my leg. I'm thinking I got it from swiping up against my son. Anyway I'm on day two of Keflex I have no reaction that are bad and it also clears up whatever is going on and it also is great for if you have other bug bites on you takes the swelling down and makes them heal within 2 days great drug....

Keflex is an excellent antibiotic for skin abscesses. I was given Keflex for an ingrown hair that became terribly infected and the infection ended up spreading to other parts of my body.  After just my second dose of it I already notice a considerable difference in the amount of pain and swelling, both are much less. Some people experience terrible side effects from Keflex but I've never experienced any negative side effects while taking it but you must eat with it and taking probiotics is an excellent idea.

I was prescribed this for an ingrown toenail that became infected. Gave so many stars because it is definitely working. Never did I think something so tiny could hurt so bad! After 2 days the infection looked and felt much better. But, I’m going to ask for something else. I’m on day 4 of these now and 3 of those days I’ve been getting a crazy headache. I’m pre disposed to migraines, but I don’t get them every day back to back so it definitely is from the medication. I’m also not sure if it’s another side affect but I woke up around 5 am because of HORRIBLE jaw pain. I do have TMD for the last 9 years of my life, but I never had this happen. I took some ibuprofen, but wish I had took a Vicodin I had leftover from a recent surgery instead because of how bad it was. Icing for a good while took the edge off enough for me to go back to sleep, but it was rough. Still pretty sore when I woke up but not as bad as before.

I fell and put two deep gashes on my shin, which then became infected.  I think (hope) this has taken care of the bacterial infection. The injury still looks somewhat inflamed but MUCH better than it was, five weeks ago. Dr originally prescribed Cipro which came with FOUR letter-size warnings pages!! Mostly having to do with susceptibility to tendon ruptures, Achilles, most common. No thanks!! Asked for something else and got Cephalexin (Keflex). Had zero side effects and I'm one who always assumes I will have some sort of reaction. Nope! Not with this.Hope everyone fares as well.

Got 500mg of Keflex prescribed to me for alleged infected spider bites. Day one I felt ok, had to go to the bathroom a lot but otherwise my stomach wasn't too bad. By Night two I was on the verge of going to the ER. My stomach felt like it was eating itself, my BP/pulse through the roof, every muscle in my body was spasming and I was in full freak out mode. Stopped taking it after that. It's been four days since I took it and I'm still sick. Dizzy, can't eat, feel crappy and weak. Doc said the antibiotics made me sick and that I had to be on the BRAT  diet (bananas, rice, applesauce, and toast) for a week. FUN!
Got this for an infected piercing. Still have bump in my ear and it made me breakout soooo bad.

The last time I've taken keflex was 4 years ago have always taken it  with no problems. I  just got a infected ingrown toenail and I've had it for 2 months the doc gave me keflex which I take it 2 times a day. I'm on my 3rd day and I've noticed some things I've never had before.  I feel a bit dizzy, I'm hot, heart racing more then normal and going to toilet more often. I think they might've changed the drug or ingredients I wish they just leave things alone and to stop short cutting things

The doctor prescribed 500 mg, four times a day for seven days as a treatment for an infected mosquito bite. The first day was fine but by the second day I had severe stomach pains, diarrhea and shortness of breath. I have decided that I will never take this medicine again.
Drug worked to cure my infection caused by a spider bite, but the smell of the pill made me so nauseous I dreaded taking it.

Keflex (cephalexin):Prescribed 500 mg 4x a day for 10 days for an infected ingrown hair on my bikini line. I've gotten lots of ingrown hair infections in the past and usually just let them run their course, but taking this was SO much better! Cleared up by day 4, absolutely no side effects, even drinking alcohol went well. Only giving it a 9 because waking up to take it every 6 hours was very annoying, especially once it seemed to have gotten better.

I had a blister get infected on a cruise ship. The on board Dr put me on Cephalexen 4x daily at 500mg for 5 days. I've had insomnia from the get go. While awake, I had dizzy spells often, and bursts of anxiety. On night 3, I developed chills, and anxiety that woke me right up. I then vomited/diarrhea all night long. I'm currently awake on night 3 typing this. Chills have stopped but I'm holding nothing down.

I have had an on and off condition with skin boils numerous, I am also diabetic and allergic to penicillin. This is one of the few antibiotics I can tolerate. I have been on this dose for 12 days, and am getting vast improvement. I am concerned though, because my provider wants me on this for 4 more weeks.. I have read other reviews, medications all have side effects, but having numerous boils under my arms, top of my legs, and under my breasts have just gotten out of control. And scars are bad as well. Just feeling so much better without so much infection and things healing up

This drug has worked very well! I had a skin infection, with a urinary Tract infection. I was put on the medicine for 10 days, 2 times a day. The first couple of doses, I didn't think that it was really working, but after 4 days of taking the medicine, then bumps started to go away & I could urinate comfortably without any burning. On the 8th day, the bumps have completely dried up and new skin is forming on top. I didn't really experience any bad side effects. The only side effects I had was MINOR diarrhea and fatigue. I would definitely recommend this medicine. My only wish would be that it would do a better job at clearing the bumps more effectively!

5 days ago I was diagnosed with facial cellulitis I went to the er and they gave me cephalexin and bactrim.  I was told to take 2 cephalexin and 4 bactrim within the past few days of taking both antibiotics my rate has gone up my jaw jitters a lot I know have a fever and my left arm feels like I pulled every single muscle in it plus I noticed 5 new blisters on my face that go red and are as hard as a marble till it feels up with puss and bursts. The only good thing about this pill is that it helped clear two parts of where the cellulitis was on my face but now I have these new symptoms and I'm not sure what to do.

I started on this medication and noticed rapid heart beat. I hate it - it makes me feel miserable I'm on 4 doses a day of 500mg. This makes it to difficult for me. I even took my blood pressure medication no help and I can't sleep. I will go to ER tomorrow for another solution if possible. This is so scary Medication too strong for me.

I'm not sure if it's working was prescribed 2 a day for 10 days I get cystic acne and I have broke out worse since taking it makes me bloated and tired but can't sleep also makes my skin super dry I just finished my last dose I hope it's one of those gets worse before it gets better, just try to get accutane.
Causes NASTY wind and diarrhea. Couldn't imagine what 4 a day would do to me. I'm only taking 2 a day and already seeing progress. How could people handle fourth a day!?

I was prescribed 500mg 4 times a day for 10 days to treat my folliculitis after shaving with a bad razor. The first day I felt okay, but I'm on day 4 and I already feel like crap. I feel dizzy, extremely fatigued to the point where I feel like a lifeless potato, nausea, lightheadedness, and some mild abdominal pain here and there. I pretty much don't feel like doing anything. The folliculitis seems to be slowly improving, though it flares up again when I wake up so I'm not entirely sure if this antibiotic is working. Might discontinue it if side effects get worse and try to get a different antibiotic

My 17 year old son is allergic to sulfa based antibiotics (he gets hives everywhere), but he keeps getting staph infections (like boils) so this time he was given Cephalexin. He got through his whole 10 days of taking it twice daily, just finished last Thursday,  The negative side effects kicked in Saturday, Sunday & Monday. Stomach pain, chills, fever, tightness in chest, frequent urination, restlessness, anxiousness and sleeplessness. He's really freaked out about it. The inability to sleep is what's actually most upsetting because it makes you feel more anxious and crazy after a few days. The crappy thing is - he just has to wait and wait until it clears out of his system. Poor kid. This sucks.

I was prescribed Cephalexin for a soft tissue infection in a finger. The drug did in fact, reduce some of the swelling. However, generally speaking, my reaction was not what I would label as positive. After the fifth day of a seven day cycle, I woke to find a major outbreak on one half of my face. On a sidenote, I was prescribed Tetracycline as a teenager for acne. And what I woke to was a flashback of early teen acne  Regardless, I brought it the attention of my healthcare provider. The general response was......nothing. The nurse, the doctor, the PA. None of them even reacted, much less responded to my concern. In the end, I have had a serious acne outbreak at 53. Appears I am allergic to Cephalexin.

I got a flu shot and the next morning I woke up with fever, pounding headache and a large red swelling on my arm with streaks that connected to the lymph nodes. I was diagnosed with cellulitis. I was clearly not swabbed well enough, if at all (can't remember).I started on 3 doses of Cephalexin 500 per day, but got worse the first day and ended up in ER. The ER doc bumped me up to 4 doses. It has pretty much cleared it up. The exhaustion has been horrific, and at times I'm dizzy. No diarrhea, but sometimes I become extremely nauseous. It strikes me out of nowhere. I find that taking Zantac helps. I'm also really, achy and all around unwell. One pill to go and I can't wait. But, the stuff works or I'd have developed sepsis, so all good.

I had scalp acne fo 6 months, but several doctors said it wasn't an infection.  So I used every, single known topical stuff, nothing worked from anti inflammatories to natural products.  I went to the gp last week with a urine infection, I said will it clear up my scalp also, yes, but only if it's an infection, which he doubted. .  And,  whoopee my scalp has cleared up and I didn't experience any side effects. Go with your gut diagnosis,  you know yourself better than anyone.. Couldn't recommend this antibiotic highly enough.

Hi,It's a wonder drug. I had an infection on my acne and my cheek was swollen.The doctor prescribed me with cephalexin 500mg for four times a day for 7 days.It works very quickly.Within some hour, the deep purple inflammation completely subside. And the swelling has reduced drastically.I was amazed.....On top of it I got also Fucidin cream to apply on the effected area.Cephalexin works with wonder !

my Doctor as soon as I start to see the onset of one of these cyst and he goes ahead and prescribes me Cephalexin 500mg capsules. And they don't even form into what looks like a little bug bite. And again it's gone in under two days. Cause I'm not sure I could deal with another Mount St. Helena cyst like before. It disrupted everything I did. It made it hard to sleep, just sit there, putting tops on  FOR SURE, walking, dancing, being goofy with my kids, and much much more. So for me Cephalexin is a miracle working drug. It's freed up a lot of my life from so much pain and allowed me to be the real me again!  :). <3

My Doctor prescribed me Cephexin and it has worked wonders. I'm so glad I'm not one of the ones that got those horrible a side effects. However, for those of you that did I'm so so sorry. That sounds like an extreme nightmare. I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy. However I wish I would have have known about it before I got this huge stiff abcess cyst in  my arm pit. ( in fact that seems to be the only place I get cysts is in my right arm pit. But this one I let get so bad I had to my Doc's right away but he's too hard to get into quickly, so I settled for the nurse practitioner. Let's go back just a bit, I mean this cyst was so big and hurt so bad I couldn't put arm down all the way without almost crying. So I got there and this is the antibiotic I  got

I had a fungal toenail infection, went to doctor, prescribed Cephalexin 500 mg cap 2 twice daily. As I have IBS, took it with food to not upset my stomach, 1st 2, no affect but when I took the next two thought I was going to die, I woke up at 2 am with severe stomach pain, nausea, dizzy,  I was draped over the bathroom counter thought I was going to pass out, within 10 mins my hair was soaking wet & had perspiration running down my face and having diarrhea at the same time I live alone,  73 was considering calling 911. next 2 mornings I saw that my gums had been bleeding, not red but dark purplish black, as I have dentures, in was inside and between my teeth, found it can cause gum bleeding. Talked to pharmacy said to stop it. Never again.

I've been fighting Cellulitis in both legs for 2 years! After 2 hospital stays & several different Dr's my newest put me on 500 Mg 4X daily. After only 3 days my legs look & feel better than they have since I first got it! Also I've been taking 5 or 10 Mg of Oxy every 6 hours to ease the pain.I took 0 the last 24 hours! The only side effect is diarrhea which is a pleasure after being constantly constipated from the Oxy!
Don't know if it's going to work or not but I was loopy as hell taking.  only took 2...the rest is going in the trash.

Keflex (cephalexin):With only 4 doses of 500 mg in 3 days instead of 3 a day, my symptoms got progressively worse. Blurred vision, dizziness, rash, leg pain and swelling, heat sensations in legs, muscle pain, back pain, swelling and pain in stomach, and extreme fatigue. Stopped taking and reported adverse reaction to pharmacy and will tell doctor. Very glad I did not take full dose. Use with caution if you are sensitive to meds.

Keflex (cephalexin):Had an ingrown toenail infection. Was given 500mg keflex taken 4 times a day for 7 days.It is working and I have no pain in my toe. However... so far I've had diarrhea, stomach pain, tiredness and weakness, dizzy spells, yellow skin, loss of appetite, nauseous, red scratchy eyes. So most of the usual stuff. The long and short of it is my toe will be healed as long as I can deal with the side effects for a few more days.

I was injected with a shot called  medrol and I have been in pain from the injection on the exact area where the nurse injected me.I've been in pain since November 2015.from the injection. I just recently tried Cephalexin and it has helped me so much.I believe the nurse who injected me damaged some of my skin tissues or hit a nerve when she injected me

Wow. Cleared up a very nasty post-surgery infection. 0 side effects. As others have said, I think you see more negative posts than positive, because those of us without complications are lucky to move forward. Best wishes to everyone with their issues.

Bartholin's cyst infection. 500mg 4 times per day 10 days. Instantly cleared infection in 2 days but experiencing severe abdominal cramps, fever, shakes, lack of appetite. Wish I didn't have to keep taking the rest.

I try not to take medicine unless I am really sick but my doctor recommended I take cephalexin for a small cyst on my eye lid.  I decided to try it because antibiotics are one of the medicines I believe are very good when you are sick and your body needs a little help to heal.  My dosage was three 500mg per day for 10 days.  After the first day I developed stomach cramps and diarrhea.  I was not sure if it was due to the medicine so I continued to take the cephalexin for two more days.   When the condition did not get any better I stopped taking the cephalexin.  It has now been a week since I first took the cephalexin and I still have stomach cramps and diarrhea.  I advised my doctor's office of my problem but they have not called me yet.

I was prescribed this as a precaution because I had a mole removed, however I had the worst experience. I don't know if I had food poisoning during the first night of taking it, or if it was entirely the cephalexin, but I had a 12 hour episode of vomiting and diarrhea, after that I was for an entire week with nausea and evidently sick (couldn't eat anything different than BRAT diet). I decided to stop taking cephalexin and in 12 hours I was MUCH better. My doctor said that since we are all different, some antibiotics might not work at all for some of us. This is the first time in my life I had a bad experience with an antibiotic.

Keflex (cephalexin):Keflex 500 mg 3 times a day is slowly but surely getting rid of my folliculitis. It took about 3 days for the infection to stop oozing, another 2 days later it has almost completely dried up. No discernible side effects for me.

Keflex (cephalexin):I had a blister that got infected from wearing tight boots for a few hours and then then I had it! I got an infection so I went to the nurse and got me some pills of Keflex for 4X a day for five days and an antibiotic cream. I feel much better. Don't ever wear tight shoes, ever.

Was on cephalexin 4 times a day for 1 week to treat an infected burn. It treated the infection nice and quick with a few side effects. I threw up twice while on it despite taking the pills with food as instructed. It caused nausea and diarrhea near the end of my prescription which made me feel horrible. I also had increased anxiety while on the medication.
Side effects included constipation, headache, joint pain.
It really works well on acne, drank plenty of water with it for best results

Cleared up my abscess ..Also I kept getting bacterial vaginitis for a year straight. I swear my bacterial vaginitis cleared up! This actually works to clear that up also. I thought my bacterial vaginitis issue was stuck with me forever.

I was prescribed this following a Bactrim DS prescription that was causing me problems.  I did not have any real issues with Cephalexin but it did not clear up my Paronychia infection as I had hoped.  I would take this again as it was gentle and no side effects at all.
This is my 3rd time on this in the past 5 months "3 pills a day for a week"  for a skin infection/eczema ( pompholyx ) that keeps reoccurring and this always clears it up! It gets the job done.

I have foliculitis that started from a insect bite. This medicine works but my skin feels so hot all over my body when I take it. It feels feverish but no actual fever. It does work very well though. I'm just so hot!

Was given 500mg 3 x daily for 10 days for pimple like rash bumps all over body and for a bladder infection--today is my first day already experiencing ringing in ears- diarrhea-- blurry vision-- and a headache. Not too thrilled I guess I'll have to play this out carefully.

Keflex (cephalexin):Got multiple venomous spider bites on left buttocks... Turned into a staph infection. Before taking the medicine I was in so much pain I could barely sit or lay down. Been on the medicine for two days now at 500mg twice a day (along with Epsom salt baths) and it has already GREATLY improved my infection, the sores, and my ability to sit!

Keflex (cephalexin):I fell off my longboard and made some bad dressing decisions.  After 3 days I saw a doctor who prescribed this and silver sulfadiazine.  After 10 days it completely healed. Unfortunately I have had another tumble, this time with broken wrist and 10 open wounds. On it again. Trusting old Keflex to help again.

Keflex (cephalexin):I had to take a double dosage of Keflex. I weigh about 115lbs and had to take Keflex 500mg 4 times a day for 10 days. I didn't have any issues with side effects or drinking alcohol while on it. It was prescribed as a precaution after I accidentally got a cut on my leg that required 13 stitches. The only dissatisfactory attribute was the horrid sulfur smell of the capsules.

Keflex (cephalexin):I had recurring boils in one area. They would show up randomly so the dr. was never able to take a culture since they would come to a head and then pop whenever. He put me on a 20 day regimen of Keflex (500) and another ointment antibiotic that he told me to dab into my nose. He said for some odd reason, boils seem to start in the nose. I followed the instructions and had a minor recurrence several months later. I went immediately to see him so he put me back on Keflex. These boils were clustered and leaving scars in the area. They haven't recurred and the scars are gone. Since I caught them starting the 2nd time, they never had a chance to come to a head because I stayed on top of it. I highly recommend it for a skin bacterial infection.

Was prescribed Keflex for a minor but painful infection as a result of an ingrown toenail. Took 250mg 3x/day for seven days and saw results after one day. Only side effect was acid reflux immediately after taking pill. I also take probiotics everyday so that may have helped to prevent other side effects.
Keflex (cephalexin):Took 200mg four x/day for 7 days. Cellulitis was still very pink and ozing. Now trying doxycyline for 10 days.

I had a small but very painful boil and the dr gave me cephalexin. It worked really well and cleared it within a couple of days but the side effects were terrible. I had bad gas and cramps along with diarrhoea.

Keflex (cephalexin):This medication gave me really bad travelling gas with cold sweats and made me very nauseous on the very first pill! I might ask my doctor to replace this medication for something else. I find it very strong, especially for a mild skin infection due to a spider bite!

I had perioral dermatitis, literally came out of nowhere, originally thought it was a pimple, then the next day just all around my mouth to the point where it hurt to talk, I left it for another day avoiding people, then the next day it got even worse, that is when I panicked. I could barely talk, eating was out of the question (thank God for Ensure and protein shakes). The doctor prescribed Keflex for me, 500mg, four times a day for ten days. It seriously worked wonders. Now I am back on this medication again for the same thing 8 months later, my doctor has no idea what causes it and apparently neither does Google. Anyways, I feel I can rest easy knowing I am on this product again and that it will be cleared up within the 10 days.
I had a spider bite, 2 red circular spots on my leg (very itchy). Went away in about 4 days after medicine.

Penicillin VK did -0-; Keflex cleared up a BAD infection from getting a 2 inch splinter out of the upper half of the bottom of my foot. Side effects were miserable: PAIN, fatigue, constipation; now 6 days since last doses. STILL, Keflex cleared up the infection that had a BROWN/YELLOW discharge. A STRANGE antibiotic, but I'd rather have pain than cellulitis.
Broke out in hives and severe vaginal itching. Doctor was aware I was allergic to penicillin so why she prescribed this medication is beyond me.

Had bad reaction all the way. Within 15 minutes of taking, experienced shortness of breath, dizziness, diarrhea, throwing up, shakiness, full blown rash/hives, cold/chills, confusion, slurred speech, rapid heart rate, ringing in the ears, extreme tiredness.
Keflex (cephalexin):Basically the only medication that works for me to combat the infections that arise from Darier's disease (a genetic skin disease).
Keflex (cephalexin):Infected Sebaceous Cyst: Needed to take three regimens of Keflex. Used Floragen 3 as a probiotic.

Keflex (cephalexin):I've been prescribed this antibiotic many times.  I just realized that with my current course for a skin infection that I sweat profusely when I take this.  The last time I had episodes of profuse sweating was the last time I was on this!  I don't see it listed anywhere as a side effect, but it seems to happen to me every time I take it.
Great on "school sores"
I have always found cephalexin to clear up my diabetic toe infections but they always recur usually days after I get done taking it.

I had a very serious and extremely painful infection where I had two large moles removed off my neck.  My doctor gave me Cephalexin as a back up treatment to the topical antibiotics. He was unsure about how well it would work on the wounds, but it did and very fast!  Within two days of the first dose I was seeing healing and in a lot less pain.  It really worked great!

Keflex (cephalexin):Works very well for treating the cellulitis I got from an insect bite. But don't drink alcohol while you are on this medication. I had half a beer and started feeling really nauseous, had a migraine and my stomach hurt.
Keflex (cephalexin):Quickly cleared up cellulitis that was painful and itchy on the crease of my leg. 7 days twice daily 500 mg.

I have been taking this antibiotic for approximately 1 year for acne. It's absolutely wonderful, no side effects and you can still tan in sun or tanning bed, most antibiotics you cannot. I also have used it in the past for sinus infections and it knocked it out quickly. I hate that I have to take it for so long but I was suffering with cystic acne and this one got rid of it, unfortunately it comes back if I discontinue use.

Keflex (cephalexin):I have suffered with ulcers on my ankles (poor circulation) for years.  Every once in a while one if not both will get infected.  Legs swell and skin turns purple as well as becoming very sensitive.  The ulcers feel as though hot pins are being shoved into them.  Keflex always knocks out the infection within a few days.

Great experience with it, clears up acne quickly.  I was having issues with getting pimples on my head. It was great with clearing it up but it comes back after about a month or so.  The only side effect is going to the bathroom 3-5 times a day. I go on and off it as needed.   Love this site.

I had cellulitis on my lower leg. I was prescribed Cephalexin 250 mg tabs four times a day for 10 days. I saw mild relief at the end of day 2 and by day 5 the infection was on its way down (less swollen, less hot, less sensitive). I continued the medication through day 10 and it did not return. I did not have any headaches, swollen joints, etc. that others reported. I am allergic to Penicillin but do not have cross sensitivity to cephalosporins.

This drug did kill the staph infection that my husband was suffering, but the side effects have been miserable. His joints are extremely painful and swollen, his knees so swollen. He has never had painful joints before -- he is a healthy 32 year old who has not been on antibiotics since elementary school, and this drug really knocked him out.
It help me a lot- skin infection cleared in one week. I had no problems with headache or dizziness.
Made me dizzy and lightheaded.

Keflex (cephalexin):I get recurring cases of impetigo and keflex is always my go-to drug. Keflex clears up the infection quickly, and I've never experienced any side-effects, even if I take it on an empty stomach.  Highly recommended!
Smells bad but works well. I had a skin infection, which cleared up within a week.
Keflex (cephalexin):Taking this 4x a day for my second bout with Cellulitis. Also taking Ultram for pain.
Abdominal pain and diarrhea after 3 days use.
Keflex (cephalexin):Along with the use of Itchamol ointment this clears boils up very quickly.

The vet gave this antibiotic to my mastiff when she suddenly had welts raise up all over. He thought she have been stung or had some other type of introduced infection. So far so good, but it seem to give her a bit of urinary incontinence. She has had that before whenever she takes any antibiotic. She is taking other medicine too, so it is hard to say which one is helping or causing the side effect.

I get blurry vision and mild headaches when I take cephalexin. But I get golf ball size cysts on my face and cephalexin really helps. I just had one developing and started taking it before it got out of control; helped so much. I can at least still go to work.

I experienced muscle pain in my arm; they felt very tired and sore. I stopped taking the cephalexin after 4 days and my skin infection came back. I started taking it again after missing one day and the infection went away again but the next morning my neck and shoulders were very sore and it hurt to move.
Keflex (cephalexin):It always helps me out. I just had plastic surgery and it helped out a great deal.
Condition: cellulitis on lower leg. Results: Excellent.Side-effect: mild headacheThe antibiotic kicks in after two days. 4 capsules a day for 10 days.

I've been taking this medication for about 4 days now.  It's done an excellent job dispursing the infection below my tooth and behind my eardrum.  The condition was very painful at one point and I hardly notice an issue now.
This was realy helpful. It was pescribed for my sister by her doctor.
